Definition.WordDefinition: Pedantic \Pe*dan"tic\, Pedantical \Pe*dan"tic*al\, a. Of or pertaining to a pedant; characteristic of, or resembling, a pedant; ostentatious of learning; as, a pedantic writer; a pedantic description; a pedantical affectation. ``Figures pedantical.'' --Shak. [1913 Webster]
pedantic adj : marked by a narrow focus on or display of learning especially its trivial aspects [syn: {academic}, {donnish}]
